justification: Identifies B’s RB depth need and playoff-schedule awareness, but ignores B’s strong preference for high-tier, young deep-threat WRs and adherence to consensus. Asking for two Tier 2 WRs for a Tier 5 RB and Tier 3 WR is lopsided. A’s injury-cautious profile conflicts with targeting a Questionable WR. The rationale is vague and inaccurate (“swapping deep threats” when Isaiah isn’t one). Acceptance probability is unrealistic.
